評論: ASUS是非常有制度化的公司, 重視員工的教育及訓練, 領導者的見地帶動讓所有各階層都能成長, 也因此公司整體快速提升,打下好的基礎, 創立優質品牌立足不敗之地,主管帶人也帶心,讓大家都有共識一同努力 ,一同分享成果.

標題: 営業として自分をチャレンジすることが多いです
評論: 研修時に営業力についての基礎知識をたくさん学びました。研修が終わったらに直接にお客様に対応しました。前職で学んだこと幅広い分野にわたりました。例えば同僚との人間関係、上司との上下関係、接客の芸術などはあります。自分にとって一番楽しいことはお客様のご希望に合った商品を紹介して毎月の実績がどんどん上がることです。一番大変なことは当社の商品を買う意欲の低いお客様を説得することです。しかし、そのようなお客様が当社の商品を納得するようになるとするのは自らの目標と嬉しさです。
Great experience working for ASUS.  Quickly left after two years of ownership transformation.  Quality was not the number one focus.

標題: A culture of overwork and underpay, with little care for the employee's longterm career goals.
評論: ***Please note that this review is for HQ in Taipei, Taiwan, though some of it applies to the US and other global offices.***
優點: I would not recommend working at ASUS as it may frustrate you to no end. A typical day usually starts at 9-9:30am, though it routinely ended around 8-9pm. This is the work culture in Taiwan, where you're expected to work as hard as your manager (ie, stay until they leave), who in turn has to work as hard as their director. It's a cascade effect as most managers are in the office until 10-11pm.

I do enjoy my job at ASUS. The coworkers and my manager have always treated me well even when the work seemed impossible at times. Keeping up with the latest products and their information is always exciting. The hardest part of my job was making sure my priorities are in check since I personally work with 3 managers/supervisors at a time. Making sure that they all aware of my work lets them know of my workload and the multiple tasks needed from them will come once notified. The portion I enjoy most is the teamwork involved with projects needed to be handled. Everyone is more than capable handling their assigned tasks in certain time frames and there is hardly any dead weight.
